content:
Hi, I am currently a research assistant professor at Institute of Urban Environment, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS). Before joining CAS, I obtained my PhD at Wuhan University in 2022 and graduated as an excellent graduate. My educational background involves geographic information science and land science.
My research interests include urban science and geoinformatics, focusing on geographic information science (GIS) and remote sensing (RS) technology to solve urban problems and promote the sustainable development of cities. In my spare time, I like to play football, table tennis and swimming. I am also a fan of Liverpool Football Club. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me.

content:
We presented our research on urban land expansion in China over the past three decades. The main focus of the research is the difference in statistical cognition of urban expansion between the administrative unit perspective and the natural city perspective, involving the modifiable areal unit problem (MAUP) in geography. This work is helpful to deepen the understanding of the spatiotemporal process of Chinaâ€™s land urbanization and provide decision support for scientific land resource management.
